text: What the human mind can conceive and believe, it can achieve.
author: Napoleon Hill, journalist and writer

text: Strive not for success, but for the values it brings.
author: Albert Einstein

text: I attribute my success to this: I never gave or took any excuse.
author: Florence Nightingale

text: Throughout my career, I missed over 9,000 shots, lost nearly 300 games.
author: Michael Jordan

text: The hardest part is to start acting; everything else depends only on persistence.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: One must love life more than the meaning of life.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

text: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: Logic will get you from A to B, but imagination will take you anywhere.
author: Albert Einstein

text: In 20 years, you will be more disappointed by the things you didn’t do than by the things you did.
author: Mark Twain

text: You should always start with what raises doubts.
author: Boris Strugatsky

text: True responsibility can only be personal.
author: Fazil Iskander

text: An unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: Eighty percent of success is showing up in the right place at the right time.
author: Woody Allen

text: Your time is limited, don't waste it living someone else's life.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Victory is not everything, everything is the constant desire to win.
author: Vince Lombardi, American football coach

text: Science is organized knowledge, wisdom is organized life.
author: Immanuel Kant

text: In my dictionary, there is no word 'impossible.'
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

text: You will never cross the ocean unless you have the courage to lose sight of the shore.
author: Christopher Columbus

text: Freedom is worth nothing unless it includes the freedom to make mistakes.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Either you run the day, or the day runs you.
author: Jim Rohn, speaker and business trainer

text: Whether you think you can, or you think you can’t, you're right.
author: Henry Ford

text: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
author: Mark Twain

text: Begin to do everything you can – and even what you can dream of.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: The best revenge is massive success.
author: Frank Sinatra

text: They often say that motivation doesn’t last long.
author: Zig Ziglar, writer, businessman, and marketing consultant

text: Weak people spend their whole lives trying not to be worse than others.
author: Boris Akunin

text: It’s all about thoughts.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: There is only one way to avoid criticism: do nothing, say nothing, and be nobody.
author: Aristotle

text: The person you are destined to become is only the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, essayist, poet, and philosopher

text: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams.
author: Henry David Thoreau, writer, thinker, and naturalist

text: I hope that at the end of my days, when I stand before God, I can say, “I used everything You gave me.”
author: Erma Bombeck, writer and journalist

text: It's better to be certain of a good result than to hope for a great one.
author: Warren Buffett

text: Some things may capture your attention, but focus on those that capture your heart.
author: Indian proverb

text: Believe you can, and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Don’t blame a child for being afraid of the dark.
author: Plato

text: Learn to say 'I don’t know,' and that will already be progress.
author: Moses Maimonides, Jewish philosopher and theologian

text: Start where you are.
author: Arthur Ashe, tennis player

text: When I was 5, my mother always told me that the most important thing in life is happiness.
author: John Lennon

text: Fall seven times, stand up eight.
author: Japanese proverb

text: When one door of happiness closes, another opens right away.
author: Helen Keller, writer, lecturer, political activist

text: Everything has its beauty, but not everyone can see it.
author: Confucius

text: How wonderful it is that we don’t need to wait even a minute to start making the world better.
author: Anne Frank

text: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Happiness is not something ready-made.
author: Dalai Lama

text: If you are offered a seat on a rocket ship, don't ask which seat! Just take it.
author: Sheryl Sandberg, COO of Facebook

text: First, decide on your ideal: set a goal.
author: Aristotle

text: If there’s no wind, take to the oars.
author: Latin proverb

text: Always rely on the thought that your decision to succeed is more important than anything else.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Success is the ability to go from failure to failure without losing your enthusiasm.
author: Winston Churchill

text: They ask: 'How do you manage everything in fifteen minutes?' I reply: 'It’s simple.'
author: Richard Branson, British entrepreneur, founder of Virgin Group

text: Everyone wants to change humanity, but no one thinks about how to change themselves.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: It is important to believe that talent is given to us for a reason – and that we must use it at any cost.
author: Marie Curie

text: If a voice inside you says you cannot paint, then paint as much as you can, and that voice will be silenced.
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: Definiteness of purpose is the starting point of all achievements.
author: William Clement Stone, writer and businessman

text: We become what we think about.
author: Earl Nightingale, radio host

text: I am not a product of circumstances; I am a product of my decisions.
author: Stephen Covey, management consultant and educator

text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago.
author: Chinese proverb

text: All children are artists.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: I was amazed by how important it is to take action.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: What is money? A person is successful if in the morning they get up, in the evening they go to bed, and in between, they do what they love.
author: Bob Dylan

text: I didn’t fail the test.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Defeat is not defeat unless you accept it in your mind.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more wisely.
author: Henry Ford

text: I believe you should never let the word 'can’t' stop you.
author: Richard Branson

text: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
author: Albert Einstein

text: You become what you believe.
author: Oprah Winfrey, TV host

text: Happiness is not in doing what you always want, but in always wanting what you do.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: I would rather die of passion than of boredom.
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: You learn the fastest in three cases: before age 7, in training, and when life has cornered you.
author: Stephen Covey

text: People will forget what you said, they will forget what you did, but they will never forget how you made them feel.
author: Maya Angelou, writer and poet

text: Our consciousness is everything.
author: Buddha

text: If you want to build a ship, don't drum up people to gather wood, divide the work, and give orders.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

text: Never think that you already know everything.
author: Ivan Pavlov, scientist and physiologist

text: It doesn't matter how slowly you go, as long as you don’t stop.
author: Confucius

text: If you think about what you have in life, you will always have more.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Quickly turn your big thoughts into big actions.
author: Donald Trump

text: To lead people, walk behind them.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Remember, not achieving success can sometimes be a great stroke of luck.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Always choose the hardest path – on it, you won’t meet competitors.
author: Charles de Gaulle

text: One completed, productive task is worth fifty half-finished ones.
author: Malcolm Forbes

text: Our lives begin to end the day we stop speaking about truly important things.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Misfortune doesn’t come alone, but neither does luck.
author: Romain Rolland, writer

text: Every thought is like dough: knead it well, and you can make anything from it.
author: Ivan Turgenev

text: Do all you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Remember, no one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The world is divided into two classes – those who believe in the incredible, and those who achieve the impossible.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The only happiness in life is the constant striving forward.
author: Émile Zola

text: It is not the strongest who survives, but the one most adaptable to change.
author: Charles Darwin

text: You can say you have bad genetics, bad metabolism, or you can just get off the couch and start working on yourself, set a goal, and believe in yourself.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

text: Not falling down is not the greatest accomplishment in life.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The question is not who will let me, but who can stop me.
author: Ayn Rand

text: When it feels like the world is against you, remember that airplanes take off against the wind, not with it.
author: Henry Ford

text: Life is measured not by the years in it, but by the life in those years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: The only way to be truly happy is to serve the world.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

text: Either write something worth reading, or do something worth writing about.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: A wise man demands everything from himself, a weak man demands everything from others.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Great people are those who see that the world is ruled by thoughts.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Before climbing the ladder of success, make sure it’s leaning against the right wall.
author: Stephen Covey

text: Every successful enterprise starts with one bold decision.
author: Peter Drucker, American economist
